title: sabre_labs
author: sabre_labs
content: Does anyone know of a way to disable Asicboost on the new generation of miners like S19/S19J, Whatminers m20/m30 etc?It seems like these miners will refuse to has if the stratum sends a version-rolling=false when requested. Is there any way to disable Overt AsicBoost on these miners be it on their original firmware or custom firmware (this is already in the wild).Thanks!

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: You can also downgrade the s19 series to a lower version through SD card flashing but the problem their live download page isn't showing SD card images. But you can still download it from the archive.org here below- https://web.archive.org/web/20220206132736/https://shop.bitmain.com/support/download?product=Flashing%20SD%20card%20with%20imageDon't click the download instead right-click then copy the link and paste it to another tab make sure to delete the archive.org link before you enter.Then follow the instruction here on how to flash it through SD card.About Whatsminer it seems there is no way to disable ASICboost because I think their units don't have ASICboost. Are trying to mine on Nicehash? I heard that the new Whatsminer units do not support ASICboost pools if you have problem connecting to any pool try to use a pool with no ASICboost or that can switch to non-ASICboost server.

comments.author: sabre_labs
comments.body: Thanks all for the input. The m20/m30 series whatsminers seem to not have anyway to disable AB. As for S19 and the like it seems that there is no way to go without AB else the older machines seem to throttle down hashing by over 50%.

comments.author: kano
comments.body: Since all mining pools worth mining on support this, I assume you mean you want to do altcoin mining.So I suggest you post this question there, not here.

comments.author: sabre_labs
comments.body: Quote from: kano on February 10, 2023, 05:55:18 AMSince all mining pools worth mining on support this, I assume you mean you want to do altcoin mining.So I suggest you post this question there, not here.Kano, its for BTC mining and not an altcoin... weird but true.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: sabre_labs on February 08, 2023, 03:03:44 AMThanks all for the input. The m20/m30 series whatsminers seem to not have anyway to disable AB. As for S19 and the like it seems that there is no way to go without AB else the older machines seem to throttle down hashing by over 50%.There's nothing we can do with Whatsminer units have you tried to contact their support and ask for older firmware? I think their old version doesn't have ASICboost yet.About s19 have you tried to use Braiins as suggested above? You can able to disable AB but I don't think it throttles down the hashing to 50% it depends in your tune or just use auto-tuning and let the braiins set power and frequency for you while AB is disabled let see what's the difference if you enable and disable AB.

comments.author: kano
comments.body: Disabling AB increases the J/TH - so is a negative - and it's quite simple and obvious why.AB reuses some of the hashing data already done to find more nonces.Thus it is getting extra nonces for using less work each extra nonce.Makes no sense to disable it at all.
